Featherlight

Gummy_bean

Summary:

Charlie can't resist touching her dad's beautiful wings.

Notes:

incest bingo: Animal Traits

(See the end of the work for more notes.)

Work Text:

When Lucifer spreads his wings to their full span, the light from the window falls on them and they seem to glow with ethereal light. Charlie is stunned into silence at the beauty and sheer width of his wingspan. It’s overwhelming. When he looks like this, she understands why he was called the most beautiful of all the angels. Her eyes shine.

“Wow,” is all she can say, too amazed to be self-conscious.

He smiles, puffing his chest out and preening like a peacock under his daughter’s gaze. “Amazing, right?” But then his proud look deflates a little and he grows somber, glancing down at the red feathers that were once pure white. “Even if they aren’t as impressive as when I was an angel…”

Charlie steps closer to him and speaks with conviction, staring at his wings with unabashed admiration. “What are you saying, Dad? They’re the most beautiful thing I’ve ever seen… They’re perfect.”

His wings flutter and shimmer, as if he were a songbird and her earnest praise was a light summer rain falling on his back. “…Beautiful?” he asks, his cheeks flushing pink.

Charlie is too busy staring at the tremor of her dad’s feathers to notice his blush. She nods. “Yes, Dad, beautiful… You should be proud of them.” Her fingers twitch, as if they want to move, but she freezes. She chews her lip.

Lucifer notices. He clears his throat and speaks, half-prideful, half-shy. “Would you… Would you like to, you know… touch them?”

Charlie’s head snaps up and she looks at him, amazed. “Can I?”

He smiles and nods, too heady with the praise to think twice.

Charlie’s hand trembles, excited and nervous. She reaches out to stroke the edge of his wing where the largest feathers splay out and open. The smooth, silky texture makes her eyes widen and she rubs her finger back and forth, bristling the feather with gentle, testing movements as if she’s afraid to hurt him. “Wow,” she says again.

At the touch, Lucifer’s wings shake and flutter, the sensation making him close his eyes. “That’s it,” he whispers. “You don’t have to be so soft with your touches, you know. They’re pretty sturdy.” He holds his breath, hoping she’ll go further…

“Oh. Okay, Dad,” Charlie says softly, and then she drags the tips of all her fingers across his wing. His feathers spread and puff to reveal the soft down at the crook of his wings and he leans into the touch, his breath catching.

“Keep going, sweetie,” he pleads, his voice coming out a little rougher than he intended.

It makes Charlie blush, but she doesn’t stop. “A-Alright…” She keeps stroking his wing in a downward motion, going with the grain of his feathers. “Does it…” She gulps, barely able to ask the question. “Does it feel good?” His reactions are making her stomach feel all ticklish and warm, and she wonders for a moment if it’s inappropriate.

He can only look up at her with a pleading expression, his face flushed and eyes heavy-lidded with pleasure. He bites his lip and nods once.

That response nearly makes her jaw drop. She’s never seen her dad look at her like this, and her skin prickles with heat. She strokes his feathers again. This time, though, she crooks her finger to scratch in a gentle upward motion. His wings tremble and bat at the touch, and a small, broken noise escapes his throat.

Charlie’s face burns. There’s no mistaking it… her dad definitely just moaned. “It feels that good?” she asks in shy amazement, her throat tight.

He nods shamefully. “S-sorry,” he says with a guilty swallow, turning his head to hide his face. His whole body is hot with embarrassment, and, he has to admit, something else. “It’s been forever since someone touched my wings like this…”

“Don’t be sorry.” Charlie’s voice is extremely soft, right next to his ear. She can’t stop petting his wings, amazed by them and even more amazed at the reactions she’s coaxing out of her dad. This is way past the line of inappropriate. And yet, she wants to see more, wants to hear him make that sound again… Her fingers travel to the innermost part of his wing, near the spot where they connect to his back.

“Ngh…” He grits his teeth, his face growing bright red. “I-it’s really sensitive there,” he chokes out, bending to hide his growing arousal.

“Whoops.” She smiles an apology, feeling a rush of blood at this realization. Against her better judgment perhaps, she rubs that spot again to see what will happen.

He gasps and his wings on the other side curl in. Wholly by accident, the large, finger-like feathers at the edge of his wing brush against her cheek and neck, causing her to shiver.

“Dad! That tickles!”

“My bad.” They both hesitate, suddenly made aware of the tension in the air. Charlie is the first to draw back, smiling awkwardly. The moment is over, and neither of them knows quite how to respond.

“You can touch them anytime,” Lucifer says at last, smoothing his feathers down and trying to play it cool. “I mean, if you want to, of course.”

“Yeah!” Charlie says quickly. Not too quickly, she hopes. “I-if you ever need help grooming them, or something like that…” She pokes her fingers together the way she always does when she’s embarrassed to ask for something.

“Oh. Wow.” He swallows, trying not to let his mind go wild with the possibilities. “Yeah. I would like that very much, sweetie.”

She grins, his response making her heart beat a little quicker. “But you have to take me flying in exchange!”

He chuckles softly. “Deal.” He hesitates for a moment, but then pulls her into his arms and folds his wings over her in a warm embrace. He closes his eyes and kisses her forehead, smiling with so much fondness that his heart aches. “Love you, my little songbird.” He never wants this moment to end.

Neither, he doesn’t realize, does Charlie. She smiles in return, nuzzling against him. “Love you too, Dad.”

Notes:

Charlie deserves to make her beautiful Daddy squirm! I based this on what I know of parrot behavior (and birds in general, I think?) Apparently stroking their wings gets them pretty riled up as it's a behavior that's reserved for mates. I like to imagine it's the same for (fallen) angels, too C:
